entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Aug 1, 09:00 - 11:00 UTC

May 30, 22:22 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Hosted Private Cloud offer.

This may temporarily affect availability.

Thank you for your understanding

entry.title: [EU/CA][Hosted Private Cloud] - vSphere maintenance notification
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jul 2, 07:00 UTC  -  Jul 4, 16:00 UTC

Jun 12, 22:47 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Hosted Private Cloud offer.
This may temporarily affect availability.

Start time : 02/07/2025 07:00 UTC
End time : 04/07/2025 16:00 UTC
Service impact : vSphere not accesible for 1h and hosts will be put in maintenance mode during the maintenance and a vMotion will be performed if it has Virtual machines in it.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy, we are rolling out an upgrade for vSphere offer.
An individual communication will be done to inform customers and you can reschedule through the manager.

Thank you for your understanding

entry.title: [RBX8][VMware Private Cloud] - Racks R807R16/17/18
entry.content:
Jun 20, 23:33 UTC
Resolved - We would like to inform you that the incident on VMware Private Cloud offer, in the specific racks R807R16/17/18 has now been resolved.

Here is detail for this incident :

Start time : 20/06/2025 22:08 UTC
End time : 20/06/2025 23:30 UTC
Root Cause : This incident was caused by a network equipment issue.

We thank you for your understanding and patience throughout this incident.

Jun 20, 22:56 UTC
Identified - We have determined the origin of the incident affecting our VMware Private Cloud offer, in the specific racks R807R16/17/18, RBX8 region.

Here are some supplementary details :
Start time : 20/06/2025 22:08 UTC
Impacted Service(s) : Some softwares are unreachable
Customers Impact : Some Customers cannot access their project.
Root Cause : This incident is caused by a network equipment issue.
Ongoing Actions : The incident has been identified and our teams are mobilised to restore service as quickly as possible.

We will keep you updated on the progress and resolution.
We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

Jun 20, 22:52 UTC
Investigating - We are currently experiencing an event affecting our VMware Private Cloud offer, in the specific racks R807R16/17/18.
Start time : 20/06/2025 22:08 UTC

Our teams are fully committed to investigating this issue and working towards a resolution as soon as possible. As investigations are ongoing, we will share any new findings or updates with you as soon as possible.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

entry.title: [Global][Backup as a Service] - KB4743
entry.content:
Jun 18, 13:49 UTC
Completed - The update has been completed.

Jun 17, 14:55 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Jun 17, 14:51 UTC
Scheduled - Please note that Veeam has released a new KB with CVEs published and impacting Veeam products: https://www.veeam.com/kb4743. We are aware of this new KB at OVHcloud and are working on an action plan:

First action: Upgrade our Veeam Enterprise Manager to 12.3.2, in order to continue to provide you the last licensing for your Veeam products. We are on it and we will provide the upgrade by the end of the week.
This is not blocking you from upgrading your Veeam to 12.3.2, you will have a warning about disconnection with our server, but it will be reconnected automatically when we will upgrade our Veeam Enterprise Manager.

Second action: Upgrade our Managed Veeam for Public VCFaaS. The vulnerable scope is limited to your backup only, still we will upgrade our Veeam infrastructure to 12.3.2 within the next days. This isn't going to impact your backups.

Third action: Upgrade our Veeam Managed Backup for Managed vSphere, we are not vulnerable to any of the CVE listed on this product, so it will be done within the next weeks.

Given the score, we strongly advise you to upgrade your Veeam infrastructure as soon as you can.

We remain at your disposal in case of questions.

entry.title: [LIM1][VMware Private Cloud] - Cluster 6171 incident notification
entry.content:
Jun 14, 13:27 UTC
Resolved - We would like to inform you that the incident on our VMware Private Cloud offer has now been resolved.

Here is detail for this incident :
Start time : 14/06/2025 09:45 UTC
End time : 14/06/2025 11:48 UTC
Root Cause : This incident was caused by an issue with the cooling system.

We thank you for your understanding and patience throughout this incident.

Jun 14, 12:52 UTC
Monitoring - We have new information regarding the incident that affected your service(s).

Please find below an update on the situation:
Update : There has been no impact since 11:48 UTC
Ongoing Actions : Our team is monitoring the situation.

We will keep you updated on the progress and resolution.
We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

Jun 14, 10:22 UTC
Investigating - We are currently experiencing an incident affecting our VMware Private Cloud offer, which is causing temporary availability issues in the Cluster 6171 in LIM1 region.

Here is detail for this incident :
Start time : 14/06/2025 09:45 UTC
Impacted Service(s) : Cluster 6171 are temporarily unreachable.
Customers Impact : Customers cannot access their datastores.
Ongoing Actions : Our teams are investigating to determine the origin of the incident to fix it. 

We will keep you updated on the progress and resolution.
We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.
